name: MEMO REALTY INC. et al. v. MT. PLEASANT HARDWARE INC.
name_abbreviation: Memo Realty Inc. v. Mt. Pleasant Hardware Inc.

parties: MEMO REALTY INC. et al. v. MT. PLEASANT HARDWARE INC.

opinions.text:
ORDER
The defendant’s motion to affirm the judgment of the Superior Court pursuant to Rule 16(g) is denied. This case is assigned to the show cause calendar. Since the plaintiffs’ initial appeal herein was apparently taken from the decision of the trial justice, the parties are directed to appear on a date to be assigned and show cause why this case should not be remanded to the Superior Court for entry of a nunc pro tunc judgment.

attorneys: Revens & DeLuca Ltd., Michael A. St. Pierre, Warwick, for plaintiffs.
Gunning, LaFazia & Gnys, Inc., Richard T. Linn, Providence, for defendant.
casebody.head_matter:
MEMO REALTY INC. et al. v. MT. PLEASANT HARDWARE INC.
No. 81-149-A.
Supreme Court of Rhode Island.
Nov. 19, 1981.
Revens & DeLuca Ltd., Michael A. St. Pierre, Warwick, for plaintiffs.
Gunning, LaFazia & Gnys, Inc., Richard T. Linn, Providence, for defendant.
